snippet: Airbnb, a company valued at $10 billion that has raised the suspicions of government officials, says that it is helping New Yorkers stay in their homes.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column examines argument from Airbnb, online lodging site, that its services promote civic good in New York City's war against economic inequality; acknowledges regulators' dislike of Airbnb's seeming promotion of transience in buildings intended as permanent residences, but questions whether those same regulators are willing to examine impact of luxury high-rises that house vacationing global aristocracy.
lead_paragraph: Airbnb, a company valued at $10 billion that has raised the suspicions of government officials, says that it is helping New Yorkers stay in their homes.

headline.main: Airbnb’s Promise: Every Man and Woman a Hotelier
